title.rendered: A Bricorama goes out of business

content.rendered:
The Bricorama store in Montigny-Le-Bretonneux (Yvelines), which had been threatened for several months with closure due in particular to the decision forcing it to close on Sundays, has officially closed, said today. now the brand’s CEO.

“That’s it, the decision has finally been made. We’ve been clearing for ten days and tomorrow we’ll be returning the keys,” said Jean-Claude Bourrelier.

With nearly 100,000 euros in monthly losses for several months and the ban on opening on Sundays “we had no choice, we had to close”, explained the manager. He notably denounced the “unfair competition” from which this store suffered, due to the installation of a Leroy Merlin nearby “which, for its part, has the right to open on Sundays”.

“Either all open, or all closed”

The store’s 17 employees will be transferred to other stores of the brand. “But that’s as many new positions as we won’t create,” argued Mr. Bourrelier.

The leader renewed his call on the government to modify the law on Sunday openings, so that everyone “is housed in the same boat. Or all open, or all closed”. If nothing changes, “other Bricorama stores could also be condemned to close their doors very soon”, warned Jean-Claude Bourrelier.
